attributes.comment:
I applaud the INS for proposing to raise the permanent resident status and
citzenship fees.
The INS is an important organization and whatever it takes to do their jobs
properly and efficiently is important. The cost for these services or improvements
should be passed on to all entering immigrants who make use of this service to
resettle in this country. No one forced any immigrant to come to this country.
Theose who come here, make that choice to immigrate here freely of their own will
and desire. We shouldn't fool ourselves into thinking that pity should be taken
upon them, because many of these new immigrants were far better off financially
in in their own countries before immigrating than many middle-class Americans
already living here.
The increased fees for permanent resident fees or citizenship fees should
rightfully be paid by these new immigrants coming to America. Americans
would face the same types of regulations if they were to immigrate to a foreign
land and resettle elsewhere. There should be no exceptions to this rule.
Everyone has to pay their fair share when they immigrate here.
The increased fees for permanent residence and citizenship must be paid by the
new immigrants, because they are the ones benefiting from these fees. US born
citizens and taxpayers MUST NOT pay for these services - it would be a terrible
injustice and burden to put on the backs of US born taxpayers. The new
immigrants must pay for the right and privilege to be here - if that is what they
wish to do.
Also, our country is becoming increasing over populated. The increased fees may
also help to act as a deterrant to some "fly by night" illegals or other immigrants
or criminal elements, who are not serious about US citizenship and US laws - and
abuse the US. I am speaking about those immigrants who fly back and forth
between their native countries (several times a year - they have the money to do
so!!) and only use the resources of this country for their own personal gain . The
increased immigration fees help to send a serious message to new immigrants
that this land and its laws must be respected and permanent residency and
citizenship status CANNOT be taken for granted.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By S. Baldev
